settings.description1: At Logan Petit Lot, we are committed to approaching nut sourcing with radical honesty. We set out to own small-batch thinking - from shell to shelf - and to dedicate ourselves equally to good taste, good health and good doing.
settings.copyright: © 2025 Logan Petit Lot. All Rights Reserved.

settings.title: ALLERGENS
settings.raw_content: Made in a facility using: peanuts, tree nuts (all types) and sesame seeds.

settings.title: SHIPPING
settings.raw_content:
We ship every Wednesday. Orders placed before noon on Tuesday (EST) will ship on Wednesday.

·    Free shipping in Canada on orders of $100 and more.

·    Orders in the Greater Montreal Area are shipped with a carbon neutral delivery service.

Please make sure to provide a valid shipping address. If an order is returned due to an incorrect address, we’d be happy to reship it, but additional shipping costs will apply.

We do not accept returns or issue refunds. However, if you have any issues with your product, please email us at info@loganpetitlot.ca and we will address these on a case-by-case basis. If your products were damaged in transit, please email us pictures and details within 48 hours of delivery.

settings.title: FAQ
settings.raw_content: Check out our FAQ for more information about our products. Still need answers? Email us! We’re happy to help.

settings.title: INGREDIENTS
settings.raw_content: We source our ingredients with radical honesty. To learn more about the ingredients we use and the people behind, click here.

settings.title: RECIPES
settings.raw_content: Looking for creative nut butter recipes? Click here!

settings.message: FREE SHIPPING IN CANADA ON ORDERS OF $100 | Flat shipping rate of $7.50 in Canada on orders between $65-$99

settings.title: Where can I buy your products?
settings.content: You can order them right here on the website. It’s a practical way to purchase our products if you unfortunately do not live close to one of our retailers. You can also find them at select retailer stores . To find out about those stores, head over to our find us page!

settings.title: Do you accept returns or issue refunds?
settings.content: We do not accept returns or issue refunds. However, if you have any issues with your product, please email us at info@loganpetitlot.ca and we will address these on a case-by-case basis. If your products were damaged in transit, please email us pictures and details within 48 hours of delivery.

settings.title: How long will it take to ship my order?
settings.content: We ship once a week on Wednesdays. All orders placed before Tuesday (EST) at noon will ship on Wednesday.

settings.title: What are your shipping rates?
settings.content:
We offer:

- Free shipping in Canada on orders of $100 and more.

Orders less than $100 are shipped according to our carriers shipping rates.

settings.title: I entered the wrong shipping address when placing my order. What should I do?
settings.content:
Email us at info@loganpetitlot.ca as soon as possible. If your order has not yet been shipped, we will gladly change your shipping address and replace it by the correct one. If your order has already been shipped, it is unfortunately too late to intercept your package. In the event that your package is returned to us (due to an invalid shipping address) we can either:

1. Refund your order (excluding shipping fees).

2. Reship your order at your own expense.

Whichever option you choose, our team is here to assist you!

settings.title: What's up with your shipping supplies?
settings.content: Our shipping supplies aren’t the cutest because we make sure to repurpose bubble wraps, cushioning peanuts, foam, and craft paper received from our own suppliers when ordering ingredients. It is our goal to reuse as much shipping supplies as we can.

settings.title: What's the difference between your creative blends and your pantry staples?
settings.content:
Each product family has its own purpose.

Creative Blends (size 250 g)

- Natural nut butters that combine nuts with other ingredients.

- Ideal for discovering new flavours, treating yourself or gifting!

Pantry Staples (size 475 g)

- Natural nut butters showcasing the nuts to their fullest.

- A must-have to cook!

settings.title: Why are your products more expensive than other natural ones found at the store?
settings.content:
That’s a great question!

     1. We pay a fair price for our ingredients

Paying a fair price means that we source supplies from producers who value environmental sustainability and respect the workers involved. We encourage transparent sourcing and that’s reflected in the price of our ingredients.

     2. We produce in small batches

The entirety of our production is made at our Montreal facility. We don’t call upon the services of any third parties to automate our processes and produce larger quantities than needed. This allows us to maximize the freshness of our products (as our inventory turnover rate is very good) as well as develop bolder, more avant-garde flavours that we wouldn’t have the flexibility to produce large scale. That flexibility and the ability to produce smaller scale do come with a price tag, however.

     3. We don't use any food additives

Our products are made from carefully selected ingredients. We don’t use any stabilizers or food additives that would reduce our production costs.

settings.title: Where are your products made?
settings.content: Our products are all made in small batches in our Montreal facility.

settings.title: Can i pick up my order at your facility?
settings.content: For the time being, our production space is unfortunately not conducive for pick ups.

settings.title: Are your products organic?
settings.content: We don’t have an organic certification, but most of the ingredients that go into making our products are organic.

settings.title: Why don’t you use strictly organic ingredients?
settings.content: Some producers with whom we partner manage small, family-owned plantations that simply don’t have the means to seek out organic certification. In any case, we ensure that our suppliers’ production methods exclude the use of any products considered harmful to human health or the environment.

settings.title: How can we identify the organic ingredients in your products?
settings.content: The organic ingredients are identified in the ingredient list.

settings.title: Are your products raw?
settings.content: No. Our nuts are first dry roasted at a low temperature, after which they are ground.

settings.title: Are your products vegan?
settings.content: Yes. Our products are all vegan.

settings.title: Are your products gluten-free?
settings.content: Our products do not contain gluten, but our facility is not certified gluten-free.

settings.title: How should i use your nut butters?
settings.content: We’ve shared a few recipe suggestions here!

settings.title: Is it possible to know the origin of the nuts you use?
settings.content: Of course! You can also learn more about all our ingredients by heading over to our Radical Honesty page.

settings.title: Must I store the nut butter in the refrigerator once opened?
settings.content: It isn’t necessary. We recommend storing it in the pantry, away from a direct light source.

settings.title: Must I stir the nut butter before using it?
settings.content: Yes. It’s preferable to stir the nut butter for a better distribution of the oil and other ingredients. Stirring will ensure you get a perfect consistency!

settings.title: Is there any added sugar in your nut butters?
settings.content: Yes, but only in certain products. In such cases, we use organic maple sugar (from Quebec). We also share the nutritional value of each product online which you can view on the product page.

settings.title: Are there added oils in your nut butters?
settings.content: For taste and texture purposes, some of our nut butters (not all!) contain added oils. To learn more about the oils we use, you can check out our Radical Honesty page.

settings.title: Is oil separation normal?
settings.content: Yes it is! Oil separation occurs with natural products, since no food stabilizers are used. Just give your nut butter a stir, and you are good to go!

settings.title: What is the white layer on top of the Peanut Chocolate Butter, and is it safe to eat?
settings.content: When natural oils separate, the cocoa butter which is naturally found in 100% dark chocolate can separate, solidify and turn white. Though it isn’t aesthetically pleasing, the nut butter is safe to eat. You can simply give it a good stir, and the oil will re-incorporate into the butter.

settings.title: What concrete actions are you taking for the environment?
settings.content:
- Our products are offered in reusable and recyclable glass containers. Whether it be to store your spices, dressings or sauces, our little jars are multipurpose.

- We reuse existing packaging materials as best we can to ship out orders (cushioning, polystyrene beads, foam, bubble wrap and kraft paper, etc.)

- We offer vegan products.

- Our promotional materials are kept to a minimum. We don’t use business cards, explanatory brochures or unnecessary gift wrapping.

- Whenever possible, we try to include Quebec ingredients in our recipes. An example of this would be Érablière Caséal’s maple sugar, which is found in many of our products.

- We recycle the cardboard boxes in which our ingredients are delivered and we select, to the extent possible, containers that can be sent back to suppliers once used. That’s the case with Caséal’s maple sugar, which is delivered in reusable buckets.

- All orders in the Greater Montreal Area are shipped with Courant +, a Montreal-based carrier that delivers with electric trucks.

settings.title: What concrete actions are you taking for the environment? (More)
settings.content: - Thanks to our partner Umano, our access to the cashew nut supply chain is more direct than the industry average. Cashew nuts from the Coopake Cooperative (Umano’s partner) are harvested and transformed at the same location. This implies that they’ve travelled a shorter distance prior to their final destination. Rather than take a detour to another continent to be processed, they make a single journey. That isn’t the industry standard; more than 90% of cashew nuts are packed up in the location where they’re grown, only to be shipped off to India, Vietnam or Brazil. Once there, they are hulled and mixed with local nuts, and then resold in Europe and north America.

settings.title: Are your products available in bulk?
settings.content: At present, our products aren’t available in bulk, as this type of distribution is difficult to implement without compromising the integrity of the products. Given that we don’t use any stabilizers or preservatives, our nut butters must be stirred before each use so as to avoid the oil floating to the top of the jar. This ensures you’ll get a smooth, creamy texture. That’s more difficult to monitor, however, when many customers serve themselves from the same container.

settings.title: Are you nevertheless concerned about the need to reduce individual packaging?
settings.content: Absolutely! We now own a bulk dispenser that may be used at future events we’ll be attending. We’re also considering the possibility of making this dispenser available at certain points of sale on a case-by-case basis. Don’t hesitate to reach out for more information about this.

settings.title: Can I return the glass jars for you to reuse?
settings.content: Unfortunately, our current production space does not allow us to receive, wash and sterilize used jars. We encourage you to reuse the jars at home. They are a great option for storing sauces, salad dressings or can even be used as glasses for serving your favourites beverages. They are also recyclable.

settings.title: Custom Text
settings.text: Use this text to share information about your brand with your customers. Describe a product, share announcements, or welcome customers to your store.

settings.title: ALMONDS - SPERRY FARMS
settings.content: Sperry Farms is a family run almond ranch, located in the Northern San Joaquin Valley. For over 40 years, they have strived to bring high quality almonds to the marketplace, while maintaining a deep respect for both the employees that work their fields and for the land they are so privileged to farm.

settings.title: CASHEWS - UMANO
settings.content:
Did you know that cashew nuts go through about a dozen mostly manual steps prior to being ready for consumption? This elaborate process includes drying, pulping, roasting, shelling, peeling and sorting. So much of this work is carried out manually and deserves adequate compensation. Unfortunately, nearly all the cashews we consume offer no such guarantee. 

Umano works directly with the Kenedougou Agricultural Cooperative (Coopake) in Burkina Faso. People employed by the cooperative work in safe conditions and are paid according to the country’s legal standards. What’s more, Fair trade certification requires that workers coat their hands in vegetable oil prior to hulling the nuts in order to prevent burns caused by the acid they contain.This technique, combined with preheating followed by 24 hours of cooling the in-shell nuts, ensures that the acid does not lead to injuries.

settings.title: COFFEE - DISPATCH COFFEE
settings.content: Dispatch Coffee is on a mission to create access to a delicious cup of coffee that does no harm. Coffee is the 6th highest carbon emission food in the world, and millions of coffee farmers fail to earn incomes that cover their costs of production. Dispatch built their supply chain from the ground up considering their impacts on people and the planet. Their coffee beans are freshly roasted in Montreal.

settings.title: CHOCOLATE - CAMINO
settings.content: Camino is a Canadian brand of fair trade and organic food products, owned by La Siembra Co-operative. La Siembra became the first registered importers of Fair trade Certified cocoa and sugar in North America. They work closely, and where possible, directly, with their partner co-operatives of family farmers to ensure transparency, respect and fairness in the supply chain.

settings.title: OILS (COCONUT AND OLIVE) - MAISON ORPHÉE
settings.content: Maison Orphée specializes in the production of first cold-pressed oils. This process implies no preheating. The pressing of the seeds is done at a temperature which varies according to the oil content in the seeds and the hardness of the seeds. In addition, they have been working in collaboration with producers in Europe and North and South America to find the best products.

settings.title: PEANUTS - ALGRANO PEANUT SHELLING
settings.content: Our organic peanuts are sourced from a group of 10 farmers in Yoakum County, Texas. We opted for the Runner variety, which in addition to having a rich nutty flavour, is also the most common variety used in peanut butters.

settings.title: PECANS - TAYLOR PECAN CO
settings.content: Taylor Pecan Co. Is a family grown farm located in North Carolina. We first met the Taylor family on a trip to the US in February 2020. During this visit, they shared with us their passion and expertise surrounding the harvest and shelling process of pecans, a process they do themselves on their farm. We fell in love with the unique taste and freshness of their pecans, which in addition to enhancing the taste of our products, offer a guarantee of traceability.

settings.title: PEPPERS (CHIPOTLE AND PAPRIKA) - JARDINS TERRA TERRE
settings.content: Jardins Terra Terre is a small scale farm located in Saguenay that specializes in the production and transformation of hot peppers, all certified organic.

settings.title: PURE VANILLA BEAN POWDER - AUST & HACHMANN
settings.content: Aust & Hachmann is a dedicated vanilla company dealing only in natural vanilla beans and their by-products.  They put quality at the very top of their list of basic requirements for all vanilla they purchase. With regional partnerships in Madagascar, Uganda, Comoros and Indonesia they are always in tune with what is happening in the vanilla trade.

settings.title: MAPLE SUGAR - FERME ST-OURS
settings.content: Ferme St-Ours is a 7th generation family farm. The maple grove has always been an important gathering place for the family. Innovative and aiming for a healthy and sustainable environment for future generations, Ferme St-Ours began organic eggs production in 2000. They also built an organic feed mill to ensure quality feed for their pullets and layers. In 2010, they transitioned their 5,800 taps to organic production. Since then, they have always sought to improve their working and production methods, for the well-being of their team, their birds, and their trees!

settings.title: SEA SALT - VANCOUVER ISLAND SEA SALT
settings.content: Vancouver Island Sea Salt (VISS) isn’t just any sea salt—it’s unrefined, pure, and packed with over 40 essential minerals straight from the pristine waters of the Canadian Pacific! Sustainability is at the core of everything they do, and they take great pride in utilizing every drop of seawater they collect. Crafted with care on their 400-acre farm, they let nature do the hard work: fast currents churn up essential minerals, while their rocky shoreline keeps the water clean and clear of sand or clay. The result? A sea salt so pure, you can see and taste the difference!

settings.title: SPICES - ÉPICES DE CRU
settings.content: Épices de Cru is a family-owned tea and spice company based in Montreal. Their goal is to provide only the highest quality whole spices and loose leaf teas, made with respect to the traditions of producers. Ethné and Philippe founded Épices de Cru in 1995 following a trip to Grenada, where they were charmed by the richness of the aromas and spices found there. Since then, they have travelled the world to bring back the best spices. The name "épices de cru" refers to a spice that comes from an exceptional terroir, renowned for the quality of its production.

settings.title: TART CHERRIES - UNIFRUITS
settings.content: 3rd generation family business located in St-Paul d'Abbotsford, Unifruits is among the only ones in Quebec to produce, process and distribute tart dried cherries.

settings.title: RADICAL HONESTY
settings.text: Curious about where our ingredients come from and how they’re grown? We work with passionate producers who share their expertise and values with us. Learn more about them here.

settings.title: SMALL-BATCH THINKING
settings.text: From shell to shelf, freshness is always our priority. By keeping our batches small, we ensure that every jar is packed with rich flavour, perfect texture, and the best possible tasting experience.

settings.title: HANDS ON FROM START TO FINISH
settings.text: By handling every step—from selecting ingredients and importing to roasting, grinding, and jarring—we ensure fresher nut butters with fewer middlemen in between.

settings.title: VERSATILE
settings.text: Our nut butters can easily be paired with foods you already eat. Sandwiches, toasted bread, sliced apples, oatmeal - the options are virtually endless! Looking for creative ways to use them? Check out our delicious recipes.

settings.title: OUR ONLINE SHOP IS CLOSED UNTIL JANUARY 2ND
settings.description2: We will ship all orders when we return. Happy holidays!
settings.btnText: WHERE TO FIND US UNTIL THEN :)

settings.title: TIMELESS NUT BUTTERS FOR EVERY DAY MEALS
SIGN UP FOR DELICIOUS NEWS
settings.descrption1: Join our mailing list to get a bi-monthly email featuring special perks only available to our community : early access to new product launches, news from us, and exclusive offers and promotions. You'll also get a new original recipe each month delivered to your mailbox before it's shared anywhere else.

settings.title: WE BUTTER BETTER
settings.home_page_richtext: At Logan Petit Lot, we are committed to approaching nut sourcing with radical honesty. We set out to own small-batch thinking - from shell to shelf - and to dedicate ourselves equally to good taste, good health and good doing.

settings.txt: FREE SHIPPING IN CANADA ON ORDERS OF $100 | WE SHIP EVERY WEDNESDAY

settings.title: A TWIST ON TRADITION
settings.richtext: Our Creative Blends don’t play by the rules. We mix nuts with unique ingredients to see where flavour takes us. Sometimes bold, sometimes surprising, always worth a taste.

settings.title: Simple, but never boring
settings.richtext: Our Pantry Staples keep it classic—just nuts, naturally. Smooth, rich, and endlessly versatile, they’re just as good on toast as they are in your favourite recipes. Spread, drizzle, cook… they’re ready for whatever you’ve got in mind.

settings.title: LIMITED BATCHES, UNLIMITED FLAVOURS
settings.richtext: Our Limited Batches come and go. They're our way of playing with bold flavours and seeing what sticks. Inspired by the spices and aromas we love, each batch is a small test run, a chance to try something new, and maybe, just maybe, discover your next favourite :)

settings.title: A GIFT THAT GIVES BACK
settings.richtext:
The perfect gift, wrapped and ready! We've curated three of our best-selling nut butters into one elegant gift box—sure to impress any foodie. But the best part? With every box sold, we donate $2 to Big Brothers Big Sisters of Greater Montreal, helping to make a difference.

Gift deliciously. Give meaningfully.
